subject: Management
title: Retrospectives
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Retrospectives.

hook.text: A team ran a retro after a failed launch. They discovered the issue was known weeks ago. Nobody spoke up.

buildup.text: Retrospectives are team-level feedback: what went well, what didn't, and what to change.

discovery.text: Agile retros work because they normalize feedback as a routine part of work, not a special event.

twist.text: The best retros produce one concrete action item, not a list of twenty wishes nobody acts on.

climax.text: Run retros every two weeks. Pick one improvement. Track it. Show the team you listened.

punchline.text: One acted-upon insight beats twenty ignored suggestions.

quiz.question: What makes retrospectives effective?
options: Producing one concrete action item that actually gets implemented
Creating a long list of every possible improvement
Only holding them after major project failures
